title: Understanding the Inverse
text: A function f can only have an inverse if for every value $$y$$, there is one $$x$$ in its domain. This is also called a one-to-one function.
speech: A function f can only have an inverse if for every value  y , there is one  x,  in its domain. This is also called a one-to-one function.
pacedSpeech: A function f can only have an inverse if for every value   y
in its domain. This is also called a one-to-one function.

title: Understanding the Inverse
text: Try plugging in the values to see if two different $$x$$ values get the same $$y$$ value. If they do, then the function cannot be an inverse.
speech: Try plugging in the values to see if two different  x  values get the same  y,  value. If they do, then the function cannot be an inverse.
pacedSpeech: Try plugging in the values to see if two different   x
value. If they do, then the function cannot be an inverse.
